50 class NodeHandleBase_
51 {

54  virtual int spinOnce() = 0;

59 #include "ros/publisher.h"
60 #include "ros/subscriber.h"
61 #include "ros/service_server.h"

64 namespace ros
65 {
66 
67 const int SPIN_OK = 0;
68 const int SPIN_ERR = -1;
69 const int SPIN_TIMEOUT = -2;
70 
71 const uint8_t SYNC_SECONDS = 5;
72 const uint8_t MODE_FIRST_FF = 0;
73 /*
74  * The second sync byte is a protocol version. It's value is 0xff for the first
75  * version of the rosserial protocol (used up to hydro), 0xfe for the second version
76  * (introduced in hydro), 0xfd for the next, and so on. Its purpose is to enable
77  * detection of mismatched protocol versions (e.g. hydro rosserial_python with groovy
78  * rosserial_arduino. It must be changed in both this file and in
79  * rosserial_python/src/rosserial_python/SerialClient.py
80  */
81 const uint8_t MODE_PROTOCOL_VER = 1;
82 const uint8_t PROTOCOL_VER1 = 0xff; // through groovy
83 const uint8_t PROTOCOL_VER2 = 0xfe; // in hydro
84 const uint8_t PROTOCOL_VER = PROTOCOL_VER2;
85 const uint8_t MODE_SIZE_L = 2;
86 const uint8_t MODE_SIZE_H = 3;
87 const uint8_t MODE_SIZE_CHECKSUM = 4; // checksum for msg size received from size L and H
88 const uint8_t MODE_TOPIC_L = 5; // waiting for topic id
89 const uint8_t MODE_TOPIC_H = 6;
90 const uint8_t MODE_MESSAGE = 7;
91 const uint8_t MODE_MSG_CHECKSUM = 8; // checksum for msg and topic id
92 
93 
94 const uint8_t SERIAL_MSG_TIMEOUT = 20; // 20 milliseconds to recieve all of message data
95 
96 using rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo;
97 
98 /* Node Handle */
99 template<class Hardware,
100  int MAX_SUBSCRIBERS = 25,
101  int MAX_PUBLISHERS = 25,
102  int INPUT_SIZE = 512,
103  int OUTPUT_SIZE = 512>
104 class NodeHandle_ : public NodeHandleBase_
105 {
106 protected:
107  Hardware hardware_{};
108 
109  /* time used for syncing */
110  uint32_t rt_time{0};
111 
112  /* used for computing current time */
113  uint32_t sec_offset{0}, nsec_offset{0};
114 
115  /* Spinonce maximum work timeout */
116  uint32_t spin_timeout_{0};
117 
118  uint8_t message_in[INPUT_SIZE] = {0};
119  uint8_t message_out[OUTPUT_SIZE] = {0};
120 
121  Publisher * publishers[MAX_PUBLISHERS] = {nullptr};
122  Subscriber_ * subscribers[MAX_SUBSCRIBERS] {nullptr};
123 
124  /*
125  * Setup Functions
126  */
127 public:
128  Hardware* getHardware()
129  {
130  return &hardware_;
131  }
132 
133  /* Start serial, initialize buffers */
134  void initNode()
135  {
136  hardware_.init();
137  mode_ = 0;
138  bytes_ = 0;
139  index_ = 0;
140  topic_ = 0;
141  };
142 
143  /* Start a named port, which may be network server IP, initialize buffers */
144  void initNode(char *portName)
145  {
146  hardware_.init(portName);
147  mode_ = 0;
148  bytes_ = 0;
149  index_ = 0;
150  topic_ = 0;
151  };
152 
161  void setSpinTimeout(const uint32_t& timeout)
162  {
163  spin_timeout_ = timeout;
164  }
165 
166 protected:
167  // State machine variables for spinOnce
168  int mode_{0};
169  int bytes_{0};
170  int topic_{0};
171  int index_{0};
172  int checksum_{0};
173 
174  bool configured_{false};
175 
176  /* used for syncing the time */
177  uint32_t last_sync_time{0};
178  uint32_t last_sync_receive_time{0};
179  uint32_t last_msg_timeout_time{0};
180 
181 public:
182  /* This function goes in your loop() function, it handles
183  * serial input and callbacks for subscribers.
184  */
185 
186 
187  virtual int spinOnce() override
188  {
189  /* restart if timed out */
190  uint32_t c_time = hardware_.time();
191  if ((c_time - last_sync_receive_time) > (SYNC_SECONDS * 2200))
192  {
193  configured_ = false;
194  }
195 
196  /* reset if message has timed out */
197  if (mode_ != MODE_FIRST_FF)
198  {
199  if (c_time > last_msg_timeout_time)
200  {
201  mode_ = MODE_FIRST_FF;
202  }
203  }
204 
205  /* while available buffer, read data */
206  while (true)
207  {
208  // If a timeout has been specified, check how long spinOnce has been running.
209  if (spin_timeout_ > 0)
210  {
211  // If the maximum processing timeout has been exceeded, exit with error.
212  // The next spinOnce can continue where it left off, or optionally
213  // based on the application in use, the hardware buffer could be flushed
214  // and start fresh.
215  if ((hardware_.time() - c_time) > spin_timeout_)
216  {
217  // Exit the spin, processing timeout exceeded.
218  return SPIN_TIMEOUT;
219  }
220  }
221  int data = hardware_.read();
222  if (data < 0)
223  break;
224  checksum_ += data;
225  if (mode_ == MODE_MESSAGE) /* message data being recieved */
226  {
227  message_in[index_++] = data;
228  bytes_--;
229  if (bytes_ == 0) /* is message complete? if so, checksum */
230  mode_ = MODE_MSG_CHECKSUM;
231  }
232  else if (mode_ == MODE_FIRST_FF)
233  {
234  if (data == 0xff)
235  {
236  mode_++;
237  last_msg_timeout_time = c_time + SERIAL_MSG_TIMEOUT;
238  }
239  else if (hardware_.time() - c_time > (SYNC_SECONDS * 1000))
240  {
241  /* We have been stuck in spinOnce too long, return error */
242  configured_ = false;
243  return SPIN_TIMEOUT;
244  }
245  }
246  else if (mode_ == MODE_PROTOCOL_VER)
247  {
248  if (data == PROTOCOL_VER)
249  {
250  mode_++;
251  }
252  else
253  {
254  mode_ = MODE_FIRST_FF;
255  if (configured_ == false)
256  requestSyncTime(); /* send a msg back showing our protocol version */
257  }
258  }
259  else if (mode_ == MODE_SIZE_L) /* bottom half of message size */
260  {
261  bytes_ = data;
262  index_ = 0;
263  mode_++;
264  checksum_ = data; /* first byte for calculating size checksum */
265  }
266  else if (mode_ == MODE_SIZE_H) /* top half of message size */
267  {
268  bytes_ += data << 8;
269  mode_++;
270  }
271  else if (mode_ == MODE_SIZE_CHECKSUM)
272  {
273  if ((checksum_ % 256) == 255)
274  mode_++;
275  else
276  mode_ = MODE_FIRST_FF; /* Abandon the frame if the msg len is wrong */
277  }
278  else if (mode_ == MODE_TOPIC_L) /* bottom half of topic id */
279  {
280  topic_ = data;
281  mode_++;
282  checksum_ = data; /* first byte included in checksum */
283  }
284  else if (mode_ == MODE_TOPIC_H) /* top half of topic id */
285  {
286  topic_ += data << 8;
287  mode_ = MODE_MESSAGE;
288  if (bytes_ == 0)
289  mode_ = MODE_MSG_CHECKSUM;
290  }
291  else if (mode_ == MODE_MSG_CHECKSUM) /* do checksum */
292  {
293  mode_ = MODE_FIRST_FF;
294  if ((checksum_ % 256) == 255)
295  {
296  if (topic_ == TopicInfo::ID_PUBLISHER)
297  {
298  requestSyncTime();
299  negotiateTopics();
300  last_sync_time = c_time;
301  last_sync_receive_time = c_time;
302  return SPIN_ERR;
303  }
304  else if (topic_ == TopicInfo::ID_TIME)
305  {
306  syncTime(message_in);
307  }
308  else if (topic_ == TopicInfo::ID_PARAMETER_REQUEST)
309  {
310  req_param_resp.deserialize(message_in);
311  param_received = true;
312  }
313  else if (topic_ == TopicInfo::ID_TX_STOP)
314  {
315  configured_ = false;
316  }
317  else
318  {
319  if (subscribers[topic_ - 100])
320  subscribers[topic_ - 100]->callback(message_in);
321  }
322  }
323  }
324  }
325 
326  /* occasionally sync time */
327  if (configured_ && ((c_time - last_sync_time) > (SYNC_SECONDS * 500)))
328  {
329  requestSyncTime();
330  last_sync_time = c_time;
331  }
332 
333  return SPIN_OK;
334  }
335 
336 
337  /* Are we connected to the PC? */
338  virtual bool connected() override
339  {
340  return configured_;
341  };
342 
343  /********************************************************************
344  * Time functions
345  */
346 
347  void requestSyncTime()
348  {
349  std_msgs::Time t;
350  publish(TopicInfo::ID_TIME, &t);
351  rt_time = hardware_.time();
352  }
353 
354  void syncTime(uint8_t * data)
355  {
356  std_msgs::Time t;
357  uint32_t offset = hardware_.time() - rt_time;
358 
359  t.deserialize(data);
360  t.data.sec += offset / 1000;
361  t.data.nsec += (offset % 1000) * 1000000UL;
362 
363  this->setNow(t.data);
364  last_sync_receive_time = hardware_.time();
365  }
366 
367  Time now()
368  {
369  uint32_t ms = hardware_.time();
370  Time current_time;
371  current_time.sec = ms / 1000 + sec_offset;
372  current_time.nsec = (ms % 1000) * 1000000UL + nsec_offset;
373  normalizeSecNSec(current_time.sec, current_time.nsec);
374  return current_time;
375  }
376 
377  void setNow(const Time & new_now)
378  {
379  uint32_t ms = hardware_.time();
380  sec_offset = new_now.sec - ms / 1000 - 1;
381  nsec_offset = new_now.nsec - (ms % 1000) * 1000000UL + 1000000000UL;
382  normalizeSecNSec(sec_offset, nsec_offset);
383  }
384 
385  /********************************************************************
386  * Topic Management
387  */
388 
389  /* Register a new publisher */
390  bool advertise(Publisher & p)
391  {
392  for (int i = 0; i < MAX_PUBLISHERS; i++)
393  {
394  if (publishers[i] == 0) // empty slot
395  {
396  publishers[i] = &p;
397  p.id_ = i + 100 + MAX_SUBSCRIBERS;
398  p.nh_ = this;
399  return true;
400  }
401  }
402  return false;
403  }
404 
405  /* Register a new subscriber */
406  bool subscribe(Subscriber_& s)
407  {
408  for (int i = 0; i < MAX_SUBSCRIBERS; i++)
409  {
410  if (subscribers[i] == 0) // empty slot
411  {
412  subscribers[i] = &s;
413  s.id_ = i + 100;
414  return true;
415  }
416  }
417  return false;
418  }
419 
420  /* Register a new Service Server */
421  template<typename MReq, typename MRes, typename ObjT>
422  bool advertiseService(ServiceServer<MReq, MRes, ObjT>& srv)
423  {
424  bool v = advertise(srv.pub);
425  bool w = subscribe(srv);
426  return v && w;
427  }
428 
429  /* Register a new Service Client */
430  template<typename MReq, typename MRes>
431  bool serviceClient(ServiceClient<MReq, MRes>& srv)
432  {
433  bool v = advertise(srv.pub);
434  bool w = subscribe(srv);
435  return v && w;
436  }
437 
438  void negotiateTopics()
439  {
440  rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo ti;
441  int i;
442  for (i = 0; i < MAX_PUBLISHERS; i++)
443  {
444  if (publishers[i] != 0) // non-empty slot
445  {
446  ti.topic_id = publishers[i]->id_;
447  ti.topic_name = (char *) publishers[i]->topic_;
448  ti.message_type = (char *) publishers[i]->msg_->getType();
449  ti.md5sum = (char *) publishers[i]->msg_->getMD5();
450  ti.buffer_size = OUTPUT_SIZE;
451  publish(publishers[i]->getEndpointType(), &ti);
452  }
453  }
454  for (i = 0; i < MAX_SUBSCRIBERS; i++)
455  {
456  if (subscribers[i] != 0) // non-empty slot
457  {
458  ti.topic_id = subscribers[i]->id_;
459  ti.topic_name = (char *) subscribers[i]->topic_;
460  ti.message_type = (char *) subscribers[i]->getMsgType();
461  ti.md5sum = (char *) subscribers[i]->getMsgMD5();
462  ti.buffer_size = INPUT_SIZE;
463  publish(subscribers[i]->getEndpointType(), &ti);
464  }
465  }
466  configured_ = true;
467  }
468 
469  virtual int publish(int id, const Msg * msg) override
470  {
471  if (id >= 100 && !configured_)
472  return 0;
473 
474  /* serialize message */
475  int l = msg->serialize(message_out + 7);
476 
477  /* setup the header */
478  message_out[0] = 0xff;
479  message_out[1] = PROTOCOL_VER;
480  message_out[2] = (uint8_t)((uint16_t)l & 255);
481  message_out[3] = (uint8_t)((uint16_t)l >> 8);
482  message_out[4] = 255 - ((message_out[2] + message_out[3]) % 256);
483  message_out[5] = (uint8_t)((int16_t)id & 255);
484  message_out[6] = (uint8_t)((int16_t)id >> 8);
485 
486  /* calculate checksum */
487  int chk = 0;
488  for (int i = 5; i < l + 7; i++)
489  chk += message_out[i];
490  l += 7;
491  message_out[l++] = 255 - (chk % 256);
492 
493  if (l <= OUTPUT_SIZE)
494  {
495  hardware_.write(message_out, l);
496  return l;
497  }
498  else
499  {
500  logerror("Message from device dropped: message larger than buffer.");
501  return -1;
502  }
503  }
504 
505  /********************************************************************
506  * Logging
507  */
508 
509 protected:
510  void log(char byte, const char * msg)
511  {
512  rosserial_msgs::Log l;
513  l.level = byte;
514  l.msg = (char*)msg;
515  publish(rosserial_msgs::TopicInfo::ID_LOG, &l);
516  }
517 
518 public:
519  void logdebug(const char* msg)
520  {
521  log(rosserial_msgs::Log::ROSDEBUG, msg);
522  }
523  void loginfo(const char * msg)
524  {
525  log(rosserial_msgs::Log::INFO, msg);
526  }
527  void logwarn(const char *msg)
528  {
529  log(rosserial_msgs::Log::WARN, msg);
530  }
531  void logerror(const char*msg)
532  {
533  log(rosserial_msgs::Log::ERROR, msg);
534  }
535  void logfatal(const char*msg)
536  {
537  log(rosserial_msgs::Log::FATAL, msg);
538  }
539 
540  /********************************************************************
541  * Parameters
542  */
543 
544 protected:
545  bool param_received{false};
546  rosserial_msgs::RequestParamResponse req_param_resp{};
547 
548  bool requestParam(const char * name, int time_out = 1000)
549  {
550  param_received = false;
551  rosserial_msgs::RequestParamRequest req;
552  req.name = (char*)name;
553  publish(TopicInfo::ID_PARAMETER_REQUEST, &req);
554  uint32_t end_time = hardware_.time() + time_out;
555  while (!param_received)
556  {
557  spinOnce();
558  if (hardware_.time() > end_time)
559  {
560  logwarn("Failed to get param: timeout expired");
561  return false;
562  }
563  }
564  return true;
565  }
566 
567 public:
568  bool getParam(const char* name, int* param, int length = 1, int timeout = 1000)
569  {
570  if (requestParam(name, timeout))
571  {
572  if (length == req_param_resp.ints_length)
573  {
574  //copy it over
575  for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
576  param[i] = req_param_resp.ints[i];
577  return true;
578  }
579  else
580  {
581  logwarn("Failed to get param: length mismatch");
582  }
583  }
584  return false;
585  }
586  bool getParam(const char* name, float* param, int length = 1, int timeout = 1000)
587  {
588  if (requestParam(name, timeout))
589  {
590  if (length == req_param_resp.floats_length)
591  {
592  //copy it over
593  for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
594  param[i] = req_param_resp.floats[i];
595  return true;
596  }
597  else
598  {
599  logwarn("Failed to get param: length mismatch");
600  }
601  }
602  return false;
603  }
604  bool getParam(const char* name, char** param, int length = 1, int timeout = 1000)
605  {
606  if (requestParam(name, timeout))
607  {
608  if (length == req_param_resp.strings_length)
609  {
610  //copy it over
611  for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
612  strcpy(param[i], req_param_resp.strings[i]);
613  return true;
614  }
615  else
616  {
617  logwarn("Failed to get param: length mismatch");
618  }
619  }
620  return false;
621  }
622  bool getParam(const char* name, bool* param, int length = 1, int timeout = 1000)
623  {
624  if (requestParam(name, timeout))
625  {
626  if (length == req_param_resp.ints_length)
627  {
628  //copy it over
629  for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
630  param[i] = req_param_resp.ints[i];
631  return true;
632  }
633  else
634  {
635  logwarn("Failed to get param: length mismatch");
636  }
637  }
638  return false;
639  }
640 };
